meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by accent.
meanings.sent1: Her accentual speech made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The accentual differences between the two regions were noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The accentual way he pronounced 'tomato' always made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: His accentual style of speaking added a unique charm to his storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The accentual pattern of her words was like music to his ears.

meanings.definition: Using accents or stress in pronunciation.
meanings.sent1: The accentual emphasis on certain syllables helped him communicate clearly.
meanings.sent2: She had an accentual way of pronouncing foreign words.
meanings.sent3: His accentual pronunciation of 'banana' always made her smile.
meanings.sent4: The accentual stress on the last syllable gave the word a different meaning.
meanings.sent5: The accentual rhythm of his speech was captivating to listen to.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the use of accents in poetry.
meanings.sent1: The poet's accentual verse was filled with emotion and depth.
meanings.sent2: She studied the accentual patterns in classical poetry.
meanings.sent3: His accentual composition left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The accentual structure of the poem created a vivid imagery in the reader's mind.
meanings.sent5: The accentual beauty of the lines resonated with the listeners.
